item.title: Inspiration and New Plans
item.description:
ðŸ“Œ Week from July 23 to July 29

The holidays are gradually reaching their midpoint, and I felt the urge to engage in something more productive.
I started working on a small project in Python for practice: planning to build a simple personal expense tracking app.

In addition, I created a reading list and study materials to prepare for the next semester.
It feels like summer is becoming not only a time for rest but also a launchpad for future ideas.

item.title: Summer Sports and Active Leisure
item.description:
ðŸ“Œ Week from July 16 to July 22

This week was all about sports. Together with friends, I took part in an amateur football tournament, and although we didnâ€™t take first place, the emotions were unforgettable.

I also tried myself at table tennis and realized that itâ€™s a great way to distract from everyday tasks.
The holidays are turning into a time not only for relaxation but also for strengthening health.

item.title: New Impressions from Summer Walks
item.description:
ðŸ“Œ Week from July 9 to July 15

This week was eventful: together with classmates, we walked around Moscow and discovered many new and interesting places.
We visited several museums, which inspired reflections on how technology influences culture and education.

Alongside the walks, I continued reading literature on business informatics â€” it turned out that many books provide a practical perspective on what will be studied in senior courses.

item.title: Long-Awaited Holidays â€” Time to Rest
item.description:
ðŸ“Œ Week from July 2 to July 8

The exams are behind me, and the holidays have finally begun! The first feeling is lightness and joy.
I dedicated this week to rest: spent more time with friends, played football, and finally managed to read books peacefully without thinking about exams.

I also enrolled in several online courses for self-development to keep up the learning rhythm during the summer.

item.title: Exams â€” the First Serious Challenge
item.description:
ðŸ“Œ Week from June 25 to July 1

The main topic of this week was the exam session. The atmosphere was tense but exciting: for the first time, I had to take several serious exams in a row.
What stood out the most was preparing for the mathematics exam â€” I had to review my notes and solve dozens of problems.

The Business Informatics exam turned out to be less difficult than expected: most questions focused on theory and examples of real-world applications in companies.
It really feels like the first year of studies is reaching an important milestone.
